results.title: Dans les Caves du Fort D'ivry
results.brief_description:
This documentary made for television is part of a series about the treasures of the cinematheques. This episode deals specifically with the Army film archives held in the vaults of the Ivry Fort (outside Paris), whose aim is to preserve the audio-visual memory of all wars.

Credits: Director, Rene-Jean Bouyer.

results.title: Dans la vie (K)
results.creator_credit: Rene Jodoin, ONF | NFB and Pierre Veilleux
results.brief_description: The film animator gives vivid expression to his own memories of a child’s first encounter with elementary school - at the tender age when grown-ups appear ten feet tall, a monster lurks in every corridor and the very walls have eyes. Feeling, but not understanding the regimentation imposed on him, the child seeks, in spite of it all, to be himself. Awards: Toronto; Oberhausen.

results.title: Danny's egg (K)
results.creator_credit: Michael Midlam, PBL Productions and David Haythornthwaite
results.brief_description: The story of Danny, a young boy living in an Australian country town, who discovers an emu’s egg and sets about ensuring that it hatches. Danny is thwarted by the school michief-maker but manages to incubate the egg. Provides a delightful look at the diverse skills required of the country teacher and the lifestyle of country schoolchildren. Written by David Haythornthwaite from a story by Jim Badger. Cast includes Ken Talbot as Danny. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Danny's Egg (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Danny rescues an emu’s egg from a marauding goanna. His ingenuity and tenacity in managing to incubate and finally hatch the egg in the face of opposition win him respect and admiration. It’s a heart-warming, contemporary story with likeable characters who offer a glimpse of life in a country town. Award-winning drama based on a true story by Jim Badger.

results.title: Danke schoen
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI secondary school media festival.
A claymation short features an older man walking along a street. He is pleased to find an old jukebox with one of his favorite songs in it. He puts a coin in the slot, but needs to insert more money. Not finding any in his pocket, he finds a bottle top on the street, picks it up and pops it into the coin slot, but the jukebox still requires more money. He decides to take off his pincenez and his nose and proceeds to put them into the jukebox, but alas, still not enough money. He proceeds to take his ears off and thankfully the machine starts to play…but can he hear the music?!

results.title: Danish porcelain
results.creator_credit: Dansk Kulturfilm and Gunnar Robert Hansen
results.brief_description: After tracing the history of porcelain from ancient China, shows all stages of production in the Royal Danish Porcelain Factory, and in the Bing and Grondahl Factory. Shows specimens of modern Danish ceramic art.
